text: |} The Winter Derby Trial is a Listed flat horse race in Great Britain open to horses aged four years or older. It is run over a distance of 1 mile and 2 furlongs () at Lingfield Park in February. It was run as an ungraded conditions race prior to 2007. The race was first run in 1999 and serves as a trial for the Winter Derby, a Group 3 race run over the same course & distance 21 days later. Since 2000 five horses have won both races - Zanay (2000), Adiemus (2002), Eccentric (2005), Grendisar (2016) and Wissahickon (2019). ==Records== Most successful horse (2 wins): * Grand Passion – 2004, 2006 * Grendisar - 2015, 2016 Leading jockey (3 wins): * Kieren Fallon – Parasol (2003), Grand Passion (2004), Gitano Hernando (2010) Leading trainer (5 wins): * Marco Botti – Re Barolo (2009), Gitano Hernando (2010), Planteur (2013), Grendisar (2015, 2016) == Winners == {| class = "sortable" | border="1" style="border-collapse: collapse; font-size:90%" |- bgcolor="#DACAA5" align="center" ! width="36px" | Year ! width="130px" | Winner ! width="32px" | Age ! width="143px" | Jockey ! width="147px" | Trainer !
